contentrichtext.text: {{Taxobox | fossil_range = | image = Goniatites_sp.1_-_Devonico_medio.JPG | image_caption = ''Goniatites'' sp. fossil (Middle Devonian) from [[Morocco]], in a laboratory of practices of the Faculty of Sciences of the University of [[A Coruña|Corunna]]. | regnum = [[Animal]]ia | phylum = [[Mollusca]] | classis = [[Cephalopod]]a | subclassis = †[[Ammonoidea]] | ordo = [[Goniatitida]] | subordo = [[Goniatitina]] | superfamilia = [[Goniatitaceae]] | familia = [[Goniatitidae]] | subfamilia = [[Goniatitinae]] | genus = '''''Goniatites''''' | familia_authority = | subdivision_ranks = | subdivision = }} '''''Goniatites''''' is genus of the [[Goniatitaceae]] superfamily. They are an [[extinction|extinct]] group of [[ammonite|ammonoid]], which are shelled [[cephalopods]] related to [[squid]]s, [[belemnite]]s, [[octopus]]es, and [[cuttlefish]], and more distantly to the [[nautiloid]]s. ==References== * [http://paleodb.org/cgi-bin/bridge.pl The Paleobiology Database] accessed on 10/01/07 {{portal|Paleontology}} [[Category:Goniatitida]] {{Ammonite-stub}}
